Frequently Asserted Queries

Is this a joke?

The rampant, unauthorized duplication of unique corporeal silhouettes is a multi-trillion dollar black market that infringes upon the fundamental rights of form-havers. The only joke is that society has ignored it for this long. Our legal department has been notified of your query's IP address and a preliminary file has been opened.

What if I just stay inside or in the dark?

A futile gesture. Artificial light sources—from a common table lamp to the malevolent glow of a refrigerator door—create equally valid, equally vulnerable shadows (see Finch vs. General Electric, 2023). Our patents cover penumbras cast by incandescent, fluorescent, LED, and halogen sources. There is no escape.

Can I copyright my shadow myself?

You could attempt to navigate the labyrinthine bureaucracy of global intellectual property law on your own, yes. You could also perform your own dental surgery. We provide the expertise and enforcement infrastructure necessary for true peace of mind. Attempting to self-file often results in an improperly defined Form Factor, leaving you more vulnerable than before.

What about my pet's shadow?

Under the Canine & Companion Addendum (available as a standard inclusion on our Gold plan or as a $12/mo add-on for Silver), the umbral rights of domestic non-human partners are fully protected. This includes quadrupeds, avians, and approved exotics. We do not currently cover insects or amorphous pets.
